oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: New Year's Show - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode features sections of interviews from: Kim Spangler (musician), Tom T. Hall (musician), Johnny Cash (musician), Willie Nelson (musician), Larry Boone (musician), Dolly Parton (musician), Vern Gosdin(musician), Randy Travis(musician), and T. Graham Brown (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of December 26, 1988. The episode is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Tom T. Hall; Johnny Cash; Willie Nelson; Larry Boone; Dolly Parton; Vern Gosdin; Randy Travis; T. Graham Brown
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Pulsebeat show -- (00:33) Tom T. Hall reflects on why he enjoys Johnny Cash's "Understand Your Man" -- (01:09) Understand Your Man (Johnny Cash) -- (03:32) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (03:38) An unidentified voice performs a John Willingham Barbeque commercial spot -- (05:18) Spangler calls Larry Boone a complete artist -- (05:32) Boone reflects on why he loves "I Have You" -- (05:54) I Have You (Larry Boone) -- (09:08) Spangler introduces Holly Dunn; Dunn calls Willie Nelson's "Stardust" album her favorite -- (09:37) Blue Skies (Willie Nelson) -- (13:21) Spangler reintroduces the program and Don Williams -- (13:38) Williams is blindsided by the question of what song he would like to hear -- (13:49) Wildflowers (Dolly Parton) -- (17:15) Spangler reflects on Exile's changing style -- (17:37) The members of Exile discuss how they can not agree on a song -- (17:57) Chiseled in Stone (Vern Gosdin) -- (21:35) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (21:42) An unidentified voice performs a John Willingham Barbeque commercial spot -- (23:13) Spangler praises T. Graham Brown -- (23:32) Brown reveals his classmates wrote "1982" -- (24:18) 1982 (Randy Travis) -- (27:13) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Hall, Tom T.; Cash, Johnny; Cash, Johnny, 1932-2003; Nelson, Willie, 1933-; Boone, Larry; Parton, Dolly; Parton, Dolly, 1946-; Gosdin, Vern; Travis, Randy; Brown, T. Graham;
